intro: Stenanona humilis, commonly known as the low stenanona, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
